ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES & ACHIEVEMENTS OF GAYESHPUR SANGLAP ACTIVITIES : Since the inception Gayeshpur Sanglap has been sincerely dedicating itself to the various aspects of theatre. The organization always tries to innovate something new in theatre through experiments in forms and contents of drama. Producing varieties of dramas, from classic to cotemporary is the main characteristic of Gayeshpur Sanglap. Since establishment the organization has produced almost 25 one act, 15 full length and numerous street and intimate theatre and performed @ 120 times per year consistently. Due importance was given and being imposed on the production of child theatre for energizing the next generation in our very own and universal art and literature in parallel with our regular theatre acting and for this purpose several workshops were organized related to theatre. We strongly believe that the art of theatre should be changed to keep pace with the ever evolving entertainment world obviously by not losing its entity. We have organized many useful workshops to develop skills on different aspects of theatre lighting, stage designing and music where famous theatre personalities were present as the instructors. Gayeshpur sanglap firmly believes that every theatre worker must be aware of the world as well as the theatrical movements of different provinces of our nation .At the same time theatre must reflect our present time to be relevant. So we frequently arrange seminars and scholastic discussion where almost every leading personalities from different fields of art participated. We arrange a four-day festival each year for the last consecutive ten years in January and also an one day celebration on 27th march, the theatre day. Approximately 100 personalities were felicitated in our festival. Besides celebrating theatre festival we celebrate World AIDS Day (6th Dec ) and World Environment Day (5th June )every year and numerous street and poster dramas are performed by our group members and by the students of the local schools where theatre works are carried on by our group .Besides these we celebrate our Establishment day on 15th August every year by organizing cultural competitions, blood donation camp and free health check-up camps and folk fest where artisans from the soil perform. ACHIEVEMENTS 1) We have been awarded with the order of merit in countless drama competitions in our state as well as in different regions of India. 2) Our members participated in the prestigious workshop done by Bond Street Theatre, New York, Exile theatre, Afganisthan. 3) Our members won the best talent award in the workshop organized by the west Bengal state Theatre Academy. 4) The playwright and the director of the group Mr. Santanu Majumder was awarded with the prestigious State Academy Award in 1998. 5) Our group was awarded with the Best Theatre Group of the year in the State Youth Festival in 2005. 6) Our group members are regular artists in television and radio. 7) Gayeshpur Sanglap has been performing in different festivals including fests organized by the state Govt. with fame and success since its birth.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Ghola Kaalmukur is basically a Theater Unit of West Bengal. Besides our Theater Team we have other wings to develop the social works for the benefit of the public. Our main activities are in the fields of ART & CULTURE, CHILDREN,EDUCATION & LITERACY,MINORITY ISSUES & YOUTH AFFAIRS. Our activities in brief: ART & CULTURE: We are performing many Bengali Dramas all over the country sometimes in our own sources sometimes with the help of others. Through this our goal is to develop the social awareness of the people. We got support from the societies. To attract people towards the theater we arrange seminars, acting workshops & Theater festivals throughout the year. CHILDREN: We serve free of cost for the children from the family of below poverty line. We give free coaching classes. Provide them with books & study materials, seminars, physical workshops. Besides we do many programs to improve their skills in various matters. We try to improve their Eye-Q level also. EDUCATION & LITERACY: We serve poor brilliant students with books, study materials etc. We also serve aged illiterate people with night coaching classes, seminars & workshops. MINORITY ISSUES: We are trying to improve the situation of the SC/ST people of the Sundarban (West Bengal) region with seminars, acting workshops & other activities. YOUTH AFFAIRS: We believe that Youths change the World. We are trying to improve the social awareness of the youth by theater acting, seminars, workshops, rallies & other facilities. Ghola Kaalmukur is trying to do their best to the humanity with their small capacity.

Entrepreneurship Skill Development Programme for Self Confidence through Self-Employment of women and unemployed candidate for better livelihood opportunities and candidates can get Skill Development Certificate from Government or Non- Government end. The program aims to provide livelihood support and improve socio economic condition of the local people.

This counselling program has been designed such that it will entail technology for the psychometric assessment of the candidates as well as person to person session. This process has been designed such that students are given a comprehensive feedback on the career pathways. As a part of the session, the students will also be provided with the details of the nearest training centers where they can further pursue the details of the programs available

On 16th February, 2016 the Government of West Bengal introduced a Flagship Scheme called “Utkarsh Bangla” in the State of West Bengal for the entire Skill Development interventions to provide wage/ self-employment linked skills training to the residents of the State. Under this scheme all interventions funded by the various State Government Departments/ Bodies/ Agencies from State and other funds leading to Skill Development shall be made by PBSSD on their behalf.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Hadia Institute of Management IT and Educational Training is engaged in providing various types skill Development Training and job oriented Courses since its registration in 2006. Achievement of imparting training in last 3 years on skill development training is given below Sector 2013 2014 2015 Total trainee Construction 20 20 18 58 ICT 416 315 212 943 Electrical 40 78 60 178 Food processing reservation 40 40 Garment making 220 240 160 620 Business and commerce 40 18 58 Medical and Nursing 40 40 20 100 Soft skill 80 80 _____ 2077 Since inception no. of trainees are more than 5000. During last 3 years we have placed above 1000 through our placement cell where there is one placement coordinator.Our website www.himitetwb.org.in may be visited in log in through Admin.Tab for details of trained and placed candidates.We had also undertaken off campus training at Govt. Home at Manikpara of Jhargram and in Midnapore Central Correctional Home Central Jail, and in Tamluk Sub Correctional Home including 5 captive ladies reported to be supporters of extremists.No. of trained Candidates in Off-campus has not been taken into account which will be a rounding 100.The Society is direct training partner of NSDC through HSSC and training partner of NDLM. Trained candidates under PMKVY and NDLM may be much above 100.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: â€œHalisahar Maatiâ€ made its first footstep in 1997. It has been working for the cultivation different wings of Art and Culture ( Theatre, Painting, Singing, Dancing ) for last 18 years. In many towns and remote areas Maati has been performing theatres and its current productions are â€œThe play â€“ â€˜Edipus Rexâ€, written by â€œSophoclesâ€, â€œThe play â€“ â€˜Shastiâ€, written by â€œRabindranath Tagoreâ€, â€œThe play â€“ â€˜Behulaâ€, ( based on Poets Bijay Guptaâ€™s famous folk literature â€˜Manasa Mangalâ€™) written by â€œSunirmal Mistryâ€, the all play Directed by Parimal Mistry. The total number of direct members, Artists and well-wishers of â€œMaatiâ€ is above Thirty- Five. The current President of Maati is Sukamal Mistry, Secretary â€“ Parimal Mistry, Treasurer â€“ Sushil Banik, and others. The chief functionary of this organization is Parimal Mistry. He had completed his Masters in acting from â€œNational School of Dramaâ€ in 2004 and in 2005 the Fellowship of National School of Drama. From then he has been actively doing the serious theatre work. In 2008, he was supported financially by National School of Drama for Theatre Workshop for the first time. And to fulfill that venture â€œHalisahar Maatiâ€ did had cooperated him thoroughly. Just like that in 2011 and 2012 the Individual theatre project had been succeeded. In 2008, Parimal Mistry as the chief advisor and guide (Secretary of organization) of Halisahar Maati had first introduced the project of theatre workshop in nature. The workshop, conducted by Halisahar Maati, had been successfully executed by Parimal Mistry. This workshop was held at the â€˜Guest House of Joydeb Mela Committeeâ€™ under the jurisdiction of â€˜SDO, BOLPUR, BIRBHUM, W.B (Via â€“ Bolpur, Shantiniketan, Sadar â€“ Illambazar, Dist - Birbhum, West Bengal.) and basically on the big strand space of the river bank of Joydeb. With all the experiences of past years, this yearâ€™s also Halisahar Maati is going to conduct that very full residential theatre workshop in the exotic Natural space of Joydeb, with the support of Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India, a Theatre workshop was held from 10th March to 9th April, 2013. Salary Grant for Halisahar MAATI has been approved in the Minutes of 11th, 12th, 13th, June, 2012 (No.F.10-02/2011-P.Arts(Vol-III),Ministry of Culture, P. Arts Section). Non-Residential Theatre Workshop held on 26th August to 25th September, 2013, assistance by National School of Drama, guidance by Parimal Mistry. This yearâ€™s Halisahar Maati is organized â€˜MAATI NATYA UTSAB â€“ 2013â€™ in the address of Halisahar, Deshbandhu Play Ground, Deshbandhu Colony, P.O- Nabanagar, Dist â€“ North 24 Parganas, Pin â€“ 743136, W.B, with the financial support of CFGS, Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India, a Theatre Festival (MAATI NATYA UTSAB - 2013 ) was held from 26th March to 30th March, 2014 ( 5 days). Halisahar Maati has taken an Endeavour, â€˜MAATI NATYA UTSAB â€“ 2013â€™ comprising of 9th Plays of different Groups from different districts for 5 days. It is the first leap, â€˜MAATI NATYA UTSAB â€“ 2013â€™ by gathering different Theatre Groups in one stage. Now our running Production is The Play â€œGADHA BAZARâ€, Written by Jousif Kamal, Translated and Edited by â€œTirthankar Chandaâ€ and Directed by Parimal Mistry. Our forth coming Production is The Play â€œSonar Ballâ€. The play based on the Famous writer Rishi Bankim Chandra Chattyapadhyayâ€™s short story Subarno Golok.
